context.note: A code signing certificate is needed to sign the JWS distribution. The following procedure assumes that you already have such a certificate (for example Thawte, or Verisign).

When running the Java Web Start distribution on Mac OS X, due to changes in this security release, clicking the link to the JNLP file does not start the application. The selected JNLP is downloaded locally. Right click it and choose to open the resource.
context.p: The following schematics depicts the Java Web Start deployment procedure: Java Web Start Deployment Procedure
The following steps describe the procedure of deploying an installation on a custom server.

step.cmd: Go to http://www.oxygenxml.com/InstData/Editor/All/oxygen.tar.gzhttp://www.oxygenxml.com/InstData/Author/All/oxygenAuthor.tar.gz http://www.oxygenxml.com/InstData/Developer/All/oxygenDeveloper.tar.gz and download the All Platforms Installation package to a local drive.
Optionally, you can customize the content of the frameworks folder, containing default template document files.

Edit the oxygen\tools\jwsPackager\packager.propertiesoxygenAuthor\tools\jwsPackager\packager.properties oxygenDeveloper\tools\jwsPackager\packager.properties configuration file. The following properties need to be adjusted:

choices.choice: codebase - represents the location of the future JWS distribution;
storetype - type of the certificate file, like PKCS12 or JKS;

optionsDir - points to the options directory that may be distributed with the JWS installer. In case the directory contains an XML document named options.xml or default.xml containing exported options, these options will be used. Otherwise, the structure of the options folder has to match the structure of a stand alone application options folder.This property is optional. It is provided only if custom options need to be delivered to the end users.

step.info: The values of keystore, storepass, and alias properties are all provided by the code signing certificate. For more information, please check the documentation of the jarsigner tool.

step.cmd: Edit the JNLP oxygen\tools\jwsPackager\dist\javawebstart\oxygen\oxygen.jnlpoxygenAuthor\tools\jwsPackager\dist\javawebstart\author\author.jnlpoxygenDeveloper\tools\jwsPackager\dist\javawebstart\author\developer.jnlp template file to modify default settings. You can specify the list of files opened at startup by modifying the <argument> list. To pass system properties directly to when it is started, add the oxy prefix to them (for example: <property name="oxyPropertyName" value="testValue"/>). The system property is passed to with the prefix stripped.
Using a command-line console, run ant in the oxygen\tools\jwsPackageroxygenAuthor\tools\jwsPackageroxygenDeveloper\tools\jwsPackager folder.
step.stepresult: The ant process creates the oxygen\tools\jwsPackager\dist\InstData\oxygenJWS.zipoxygenAuthor\tools\jwsPackager\dist\InstData\authorJWS.zipoxygenDeveloper\tools\jwsPackager\dist\InstData\authorJWS.zip archive that contains the actual remote JWS installer.

step.cmd: Copy the expanded content of the archive to the folder specified in the codebase property, previously set in the packager.properties file.
Using your favorite web browser, go to the address specified in the codebase property or to its parent folder and start the remote installer.
